numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This graph shows a comparison between young adults and middle-aged adults.
2. A young adult is a person who is 15 years old or older and who is 24 years old or younger.
3. A middle-aged adult is a person who is 40 years old.
4. The graph shows the amount of optimism for the future.
5. The results highlight that young adults are much more optimistic about themselves.
6. The results highlight that young adults are much more optimistic about their future world.
7. The results highlight that middle-aged adults believe that there is little hope for the future.
9. It is worrying that middle-aged adults are so negative about our future.
10. This possibly means that middle-aged adults see a future that young adults cannot see.
15. These countries are lower in socio-economic status.
16. These countries rely more on religion.
17. In these countries, a significantly higher percentage of young adults have beliefs of improvement for our future generations.
18. In these countries, a significantly higher percentage of middle-aged adults have beliefs of improvement for our future generations.
